metadata.title: CVE-2016-10317 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The fill_threshhold_buffer function in base/gxht_thresh.c in ArtifexSoftware, Inc. Ghostscript 9.20 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted PostScript document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.10~dfsg-0ubuntu10.12
ghostscript-x - 9.10~dfsg-0ubuntu10.12
libgs9 - 9.10~dfsg-0ubuntu10.12
libgs9-common - 9.10~dfsg-0ubuntu10.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.10~dfsg-0ubuntu10.12').
